options.text: Australopithecus - Lived in East African grasslands.
Ramapithecus  - It was more ape like.
Neanderthal Man - Believed in burial customs.

solution.text:
Stages of Human Description
Dryopithecus and Ramapithecus (About 15 mya ) - These primates were hairy and walked like gorillas and chimpanzees. - Dryopithecus : More ape-like. - Ramapithecus : More man-like.
Australopithecines ( 2 mya ) - Lived in East African grasslands. - These use stone weapons for hunting but also ate fruits.
Homo habilis - First human-like being : the hominid. - Cranial capacity : 650-800cc . - These probably did not eat meat.
Neanderthal man ( 1,00,000-40,000 years back) - Lived near east and central Asia. - Cranial capacity : 1400cc . - These people used hides to protect their body and buried their dead.
